citeinfo.origin: National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration, National Marine Fisheries Service, Northwest Regional Office
citeinfo.title: EFH Conservation Areas off Washington, Oregon, and California for NMFS' Final Rule Implementing Amendment 19 to the Pacific Coast Groundfish Fishery Management Plan

descript.abstract: These data depict Essential Fish Habitat (EFH) conservation areas off Washington, Oregon, and California. The coordinate locations are from NMFS' Final Rule to implement Amendment 19 to the Pacific Coast Groundfish Fishery Management Plan (71 FR 27408; May 11, 2006). In order to minimize to the extent practicable adverse effects from fishing, the final rule prohibits fishing with various gear types within these areas. Consult the text of the final rule for specific details about each area and the management measures. The prohibitions are listed in Section 660.306 and the official coordinates are listed in Sections 660.397, 660.398, and 660.399 of the final rule.
descript.purpose: These data were developed to support implementation of NMFS' Final Rule implementing amendment 19 to the Pacific Coast Groundfish Fishery Management Plan (FMP).
descript.supplinf: These boundaries were created by an automated process to extract the coordinates from the text of the Final Rule. Any discrepancies between these coordinates and the Federal Register will be resolved in favor of the Federal Register.

cntorgp.cntorg: NOAA, National Marine Fisheries Service, Northwest Region

idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 2; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.1.0.722

attracc.attraccr: Attributes were generated via an automated process from the text of the Federal Register document. Attributes were visually assessed for accuracy.

dataqual.logic: The areas were derived from the Federal Register document, and the caveats associated with the source data would apply to this line.
dataqual.complete: The areas are complete within the west coast Exclusive Economic Zone (EEZ).

horizpa.horizpar: Horizontal accuracy is assumed to be absolute because coordinate locations were extracted in an automated process from the text of the Federal Register.

citeinfo.origin: National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration, National Marine Fisheries Service
citeinfo.title: Magnuson-Stevens Act Provisions; Fisheries Off West Coast States; Pacific Coast Groundfish Fishery
citeinfo.othercit: Federal Register, Vol. 71, No. 91, page 27408. 50 CFR Part 660, [Docket No. 051213334-6119-02; I.D. 112905C], RIN 0648-AT98

citeinfo.origin: Department of Commerce (DOC), National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA), Office of Coast Survey (OCS), Coast Survey Development Laboratory (CSDL)
citeinfo.title: U.S. Merged Vector Shoreline Derived from NOAA Nautical Charts

srcinfo.srccontr: Provides mean high water shoreline delineation

procstep.procdesc: (1) Extracted point coordinates and area name from Federal Register text using Perl script. (2) Created ArcInfo format line coverage. (3) For areas that had the high water line as a boundary, or that overlapped with land, combined with lines from NOAA' merged vector shoreline to create closed polygons.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.
Geographic names for the area depicted
Type of fishing gear that is prohibited within the area

cntorgp.cntorg: NOAA, National Marine Fisheries Service, Northwest Region

distinfo.distliab: These data do not constitute legal boundaries. Any discrepancies between these coordinates and the Federal Register will be resolved in favor of the Federal Register.

metainfo.metstdn: FGDC Content Standards for Digital Geospatial Metadata
